title: Le big rewrite
body:
A rewrite using async and Hyper with full support for multi-threaded test runs, multiple servers/endpoints and other goodies.

The old interface will still be accessible in this version, but will be marked as deprecated, since it still relies on the locking mechanism.

Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/92 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/94 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/144 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/150

Potentially closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/111 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/140 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/147

TODO:

- [x] Document the server
- [x] Add an HTTP2 test
- [x] Introduce an Error type
- [x] Check for unnecessary unwraps
- [x] Update the README
- [x] Update/remove the benchmark test
- [x] Introduce an error context

title: Handle httpparse error
body:
When httpparse fails to parse a request, it will return an error. For instance when a header is invalid, httparse will return error `Error::HeaderName`.
The current logic was to mark the error and re-enter the loop. When this happens, the buffer may be empty and the test will block indefinitely.

This change marks the request as `parsed` when httparse returns an error parsing the content so this can be returned back to the client.

title: Replace difference library with similar
body:
Replace difference library with similar because difference is no longer
maintained. See advisory: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0095

Updated related tests due to slightly different diffing output.

Fixes #132

title: Update assert-json-diff to 2.0.0
body: I recently released assert-json-diff 2.0.0 which had [a few breaking changes](https://github.com/davidpdrsn/assert-json-diff/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200---2021-01-23).

title: Some changes to travis.yml and README
body: Small follow-up to https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/pull/134

title: Upgrade deps
body:
> mockito$ cargo upgrades
> All dependencies are up to date!

title: Fix clippy, option 2
body:
Hi, this is the second option to fix linting issues arisen in #128. This is **alternative** to #129.

A great shout out to @wolf4ood that concoted this solution. The details are in the last commit message, but the juice is the choice to compare only a part of the BodyFn bear by the `Body::Fn` variant.

title: Match binary body
Add a matched() -> bool method to mock
body:
Hi!

Thanks so much for this library - I really appreciate the work you've put into it! I have a slightly unusual use case surrounding testing async processing and I'd basically like to check to see if the mock has matched while not panicking. It looks like `mockito::mock` isn't `UnwindSafe` so catching the `assert` panic requires wrapping it in a `AssertUnwindSafe` which I'm not totally sure is correct.

This just provides a `matched` method that returns a bool for this particular use case. Let me know what you think/if it's appropriate or not!


Thanks!!!

title: Bump minimum supported Rust toolchain to 1.36
fix: use serde_urlencoded for query matching
body:
This is a fix that resolves #121 and also comes with a slightly leaner implementation of `Matcher::UrlEncoded`'s match arm in `Matcher::matches_value`

Open to any feedback / suggestions!

title: Improve Matcher display
body:
Hi! First off, thanks so much for the library - it's been *_super_* useful to me across several projects!

I was struggling with a test that had an `AllOf` match that wasn't matching, and in the error output I was getting:
```
> Expected 1 request(s) to:

GET /path?(all of)
accept: (any)
host: (any)
```
I thought it might be useful to be able to actually see all of the queries that were expected to match.

In doing so, I refactored the `Display` logic a bit to reduce some of what I thought were duplications.

There are tests that demonstrate the new output, but in summary, it looks like:
```
> Expected 1 request(s) to:

GET /path?(query1, query2 (regex), key3=val3 (urlencoded)) (all of)
accept: (any)
host: (any)
```
It seemed to follow the precedence and I'd be happy to make any changes to it.

Let me know if you have any questions, etc

Thanks!

title: Fix json in docs
body:
Fortunately, rust provides raw strings literals r#"..."#
which makes writing json literals very easy.

Also, I think doc strings and mocking examples should be tested as well. Just in case.

title: Warnings on missing .create()
body: As discussed in #112

title: Prefer assert_json_include_no_panic over deprecated version
body:
Closes #109 

Closes https://github.com/davidpdrsn/assert-json-diff/issues/13

title: Update assert-json-diff version.
body:
Hi. We are using your library in our project https://github.com/tg-rs/tg-rs 

But suddenly found that CI can't pass tests.
```
error[E0432]: unresolved imports `assert_json_diff::Actual`, `assert_json_diff::Comparison`, `assert_json_diff::Expected`
   --> /home/vladimir/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/mockito-0.23.1/src/lib.rs:565:46
    |
565 | use assert_json_diff::{assert_json_no_panic, Actual, Comparison, Expected};
    |                                              ^^^^^^  ^^^^^^^^^^  ^^^^^^^^ no `Expected` in the root
    |                                              |       |
    |                                              |       no `Comparison` in the root
    |                                              no `Actual` in the root

error[E0061]: this function takes 3 parameters but 1 parameter was supplied
   --> /home/vladimir/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/mockito-0.23.1/src/lib.rs:680:17
    |
680 |                 assert_json_no_panic(Comparison::Include(actual, expected)).is_ok()
    |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected 3 parameters

error[E0061]: this function takes 3 parameters but 1 parameter was supplied
   --> /home/vladimir/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/mockito-0.23.1/src/lib.rs:687:17
    |
687 |                 assert_json_no_panic(Comparison::Include(actual, expected)).is_ok()
    |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected 3 parameters

error: aborting due to 3 previous errors

```


We found that source of problem was in [assert-json-diff#11](https://github.com/davidpdrsn/assert-json-diff/issues/11) library.

I have updated library in order to fix the build.
But i also found that method `assert_json_no_panic` is marked as `#[doc(hidden)]` so probably you should avoid using undocumented methods in future.

title: Set the 'connection: close' header
body: Closes #103

title: Bump dependency
body: Also `^` in Cargo doesn't do anything (it's the default behavior)

title: Fix Appveyor tests by disabling the color feature for Appveyor builds
Proposal: multiple mock matching
body:
This is an implementation proposal of the feature previously discussed in issue #97.

The idea is to detect if there is multiple mock matching the same request and calling them while the number of request expected is not reached. When it is reached we call the next one. If there is no more available we keep calling the last one.

title: add support for at_least and at_most
body: Add functions `expect_at_least` and `expect_at_most` as described in issue #79.

title: Check rustfmt as part of CI
Fix some edition idioms and run cargo fmt
body:
I noticed that you did some formatting changes in 3b519bb.

To make it easier for contributors to adhere to a common style, would you be willing to use `cargo fmt`?
This would also make the code more consistent with other codebases using the same tool.

title: Fix queries in the path as sub matchers + Cleanup
body: Fixes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/86

title: use the Rust 2018 edition
body: I have just done the minimum steps outlined in the [Edition guide](https://doc.rust-lang.org/edition-guide/editions/transitioning-an-existing-project-to-a-new-edition.html#updating-your-code-to-be-compatible-with-the-new-edition) without edition idiom migration

title: Move colored diff output to feature flag
body:
This allows one to use  this crate without bringing in the pretty big `colored` crate dependency and for when colored text diffs are not important.

The new `color` feature flag is enabled by default so no change in the default behavior

title: adds PartialJson and PartialJsonString matchers
body:
This PR adds the ability to match partially a json body.
I've included the [assert_json_diff](https://crates.io/crates/assert-json-diff) library that does just that, verify that a json is "included" in another.

title: Allow generating response programmatically
body: Fixes #64

title: Introduce Matcher::UrlEncoded to match url encoded data - especially query parameters
Bump dependencies (rand) and increase the minimum supported toolchain version
body: Closes #73

title: Matcher::AllOf
body: Closes #72

title: Few fixes needed when packaging for Fedora
Support HTTP/1.0 and working without Content-Length
body:
* Propagate the version of HTTP protocol to a response.
* Handle large bodies without "Content-Length" (HTTP/1.0).

title: Allow overriding the content-length header
body: Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/52

title: Fix request parsing (fixes #60)
body:
While investigating issue #60, I found that at times not the entire request body is read after one `stream.read` call. I noticed that from time to time code was reading only 123 bytes out of 125. Remaining 2 bytes were making request body JSON impossible to parse which has resulted into the error that I've reported in comments for #60.

I also noticed that current implementation does not allow reading requests that are longer than 1024 bytes. I've tried to address it.

Another issue that I found is that even parser status is `httparse::Status::Complete`, it does not mean that entire body was read already. It should be fixed in proposed PR as well. 

It is tricky to automate testing of scenario when not entire request is read in one take, since it's random. Instead I've added a test that ensures that we can parse request that is longer than 1024 bytes.

title: Pull/58
body: Same as https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/pull/58 but with clippy fixes on top.

title: Use auto-assigned port
body:
This change makes mockito use a random free port assigned by the operating system.

The upside is that the port number won't conflict with any application, including other test processes that might be running in parallel.

The downside is that it's no longer possible to have `SERVER_ADDRESS` as a constant. It has to be a function call, so it's a breaking change.

title: Precise listening notification
body:
Busy-looping `while !is_listening() {}` wasn't very nice. 

Additionally, it'd say `true` when the port was used by another application, which lead to misleading test failures.

title: Use the log crate instead of own logger
body: The `log` crate is a de-facto standard, and this helps integrate with other logger outputs.

title: lib: keep compatibility with older toolchains
body: This adds a compatibility `use` statement so that `mockito` can be successfully built on slightly older toolchains, and adds a travis check for that (arbitrary minimum version: 1.29.0).

title: Make clippy happy
body:
The goal of this PR is to make this repository work well with [clippy](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy).
Clippy provides guidelines on how to write more idiomatic rust code and allow to reduce complexity.
I did noticed those issues while running `cargo clippy` on a personal library as clippy runs on all the dependencies (and mockito is among them 😃 ).

The provided changes are directly suggested by clippy and I did no other fixes that could seem reasonable (for example the not needed write call in [here](https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/compare/master...macisamuele:maci-run-clippy?expand=1#diff-2873e3b87f87572c686867a1c112e3fdR114)).

In order to guarantee that the codebase will be compliant with clippy I've added the checks on the travis files, so the build won't be green if clippy is unhappy.

NOTE: I would also suggest to use [`cargo fmt`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rustfmt) to ensure that the stile of the codebase is consistent, but this will result into a much bigger change and is not blocking me in any way. So I would prefer the maintainer decides whether to do it or not (TIP: on my personal project I've set up [pre-commit](https://pre-commit.com) to ensure style consistency, [example](https://github.com/macisamuele/jsonschema-validator/blob/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L17)).

title: Fix Windows build and doctest failures.
body:
Fixes #41 and #36

Substitute [http_muncher] with [httparse]

title: Add missed test for bodies read from files
body: I dunno why there were no tests for this feature and also why simple.http was provided with a status line considering the feature being about bodies only. So I decided to change this it.

title: Uppercase the incoming request method
body:
When running tests using mockito in win-64, incoming requests frequently parse as `<unknown>` for some reason. To allow our tests to run and pass in win-64, we would like to be able to match `<unknown>`, but that is not currently possible because the mocked method is converted to uppercase (in `Mock::new()`).

This PR converts the incoming request to uppercase, so that `<unknown>` --> `<UNKNOWN>`, and we can match against it.

title: Update dependencies
body:
The update was simple and just had to fix few warnings.

 - lazy_static
 - rand
 - regex

Signed-off-by: Otavio Salvador <otavio@ossystems.com.br>

title: Multivalued headers
body:
The `Via` header supports multiple values only as separate headers, so to test it, it's necessary to support multiple values per header.

At this point matching with `PartialEq` was getting too wild, so I've just changed it to a regular method.

title: 'Or' Matcher
body:
Allows combining of matchers into "one or the other" expression.

Implements `PartialEq` on `Option<&str>` instead of `String`, which removes need to check for `Missing` separately.

title: More informative status line
body: A generic 501 response is a little surprising. I've changed the status text to hint its coming from Mockito.

title: Support binary responses
body: Fixes #42

body: …but break creating mocks from within sub-threads.

body: Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/23

body:
...by ensuring internally that tests creating mocks run sequentially.

A simpler, less intrusive alternative to https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/pull/34

title: Added `Matcher::JSON` to match json bodies.
body:
This is helpful in scenarios where the posted body is expected to be a
JSON document. Since the order of keys in a JSON document is not
guaranteed it is required to compare the paresed representation.

title: bind server address once
body:
Hello!
It's me again.

In my test all mocks are unique and I want run tests without `--test-threads=1`

```
$ cargo test --all
...
running 3 tests
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Error { repr: Os { code: 98, message: "Address already in use" } }', /checkout/src/libcore/result.rs:860:4
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Error { repr: Os { code: 98, message: "Address already in use" } }', /checkout/src/libcore/result.rs:860:4
test test_1... ok
test test_2 ... ok
test test_3 ... ok
```

With this PR  tests runs without noise about paniced threads.

```
$ cargo test --all
...
running 3 tests                    
test test_1 ... ok                             
test test_2 ... ok       
test test_3 ... ok       

test result: ok. 3 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out 
```

Note this PR does't solve problem testings when mocks are duplicated without `--test-threads=1`

Sorry about my poor English.

title: don't panic about Utf8Error on large utf8 body
body:
Hello!
It's me again )

Sorry about noise from me, but I'm have `Utf8Error` issue when mock response with utf8 files around 200-500K. 

Bug was on code:
```
self.body.push_str(str::from_utf8(value).unwrap());
```
Where `value` is 1024 length buffer of `u8` wich can contain not valid utf8 string (truncated if source utf8 string large then 1024 bytes) and on `unwrap` mocking server panics with  `Utf8Error`

Solution is:
 - gather full request body to `Vec<u8>` from read buffer
 - deserilize raw request body from slice directly and don't panic on some error

title: basic regex support
body:
Hi!
I want a regex support to mock URL path.
This is my vision how to add it. I`m newbie in rust.

Regex used by default for all paths. This is a breaking change...
And `mock("/ab")` will match `/abcd`.

Sorry for my poor English.

title: Preserve response header order
body:
I came across some intermittent test failures when working on some code that serializes HTTP responses. This seemed like it should be deterministic, so this was very surprising.

It turned out that the problem came from Mockito using a `HashMap` to store response headers. Switching this to an array, and explcitly specifying a static `Date` header, should be enough to make Mockito responses entirely deterministic, which is especially desirable in a library focused on testing.

title: Don't expose server to the network
body: Currently, Mockito binds its server to 0.0.0.0, which exposed the server to every host on the network. This _probably_ isn't the correct behavior. It also generated several annoying firewall popups per test run on my machine (using the default macOS firewall settings, AFAIK). This PR changes the server to run on 127.0.0.1, so it's not accessible to other machines.

title: cargo: update serde suite to v1
Change usage of rustc_serialize to serde
